In RStudio:

**This step will download all the files for the workshop.**

Under the `File` menu, choose `New Project`. Select `From Version Control, and then
`Git`. In the `Repository URL,` enter

https://github.com/dwbapst/PaleoSoc_phylo_short_course_2019

In the boxes `Project Directory Name`, and `Create project as a subdirectory of`,
you may choose custom names and locations for your folder.

In browser:

- Choose a __command-line binary__ of PAUP for your system [here](http://phylosolutions.com/paup-test/)
- Choose a command line binary of RevBayes for your system [here](https://revbayes.github.io/software)
- [Tracer](http://tree.bio.ed.ac.uk/software/tracer/), for viewing posterior samples
- [FigTree](http://tree.bio.ed.ac.uk/software/figtree/), for tree viewing
